          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "class ApplicationController < ActionController::Base\n  before_action :set_locale\n\n  protected\n\n  def set_locale\n    # Remove inappropriate/unnecessary ones\n    I18n.locale = params[:locale] ||    # Request parameter\n      session[:locale] ||               # Current session\n      (current_user.preferred_locale if user_signed_in?) ||  # Model saved configuration\n      extract_locale_from_accept_language_header ||          # Language header - browser config\n      I18n.default_locale               # Set in your config files, english by super-default\n  end\n\n  # Extract language from request header\n  def extract_locale_from_accept_language_header\n    if request.env['HTTP_ACCEPT_LANGUAGE']\n      lg = request.env['HTTP_ACCEPT_LANGUAGE'].scan(/^[a-z]{2}/).first.to_sym\n      lg.in?([:en, YOUR_AVAILABLE_LANGUAGES]) ? lg : nil\n    end\n  end"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 1

            "title": [
              ["By doing this, visiting "],
              ["http://yourapplication.com/en/products", [["c"]]],
              [" will set your locale to "],
              [":en", [["c"]]],
              [". Instead, visiting "],
              ["http://yourapplication.com/fr/products", [["c"]]],
              [" will set it to "],
              [":fr", [["c"]]],
              [
                ". Furthermore, you won’t get a routing error when missing the "
              ],
              [":locale", [["c"]]],
              [" param, as visiting "],
              ["http://yourapplication.com/products", [["c"]]],
              [" will load the default "],
              ["I18n", [["b"]]],
              [" locale."]
